data.text: @hcldr Adopt hand washing, sneeze & cough covering, staying home when sick, seeking medical care of suspicious illnesses, protecting yourself, protecting others, understanding #publichealth basics, and sharing knowledge & experiences w/ others.
@hcldr T4b I'd wish for flexibility to remain, like more remote work and virtual conferences, which allow for people who have less money or ability to travel the possibility to attend. #hcldr

@hcldr T4a COVID-19 isn't endemic yet. But people should always wear a mask when sick and continue washing their hands even though it's not useful to prevent COVID (as it's spread through the AIR, like smoke). Tip: the quality and fit of a mask are thus the most important. #hcldr

@hcldr T2: Vaccines, wear a mask in crowded indoor places, stay 6 feet away from others, keep testing, wash your hands often, remote work if wanted, cover coughs and sneezes, monitor your health, and my list keeps going :) #hcldr
@hcldr Also yes I did just get distracted #hcldr
@hcldr Washing their hands #hcldr Iâ€™ve been amazed how often kids must go to school sick.

@hcldr T4 Washing hands. As a Mom, curbside services has been a blessing. And the realization that one size does not fit all when it comes to access to anything: education, healthcare, transportation, food, etc. #hcldr
